info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:50PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Warren and central Washington Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 249 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Glens Falls North, or near Glens Falls, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Glens Falls, Hudson Falls, Warrensburg, Whitehall, Lake George Village, Hartford, Hague, Eagle Point Campground, Scaroon Manor Public Campground, Comstock, Bolton Landing, Rogers Rock Campground, Chestertown, Glens Falls North, Huletts Landing, West Glens Falls, Putnam, Queensbury, Kingsbury and Mount Hope. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. If on or near Lake George, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from thunderstorms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
